Name: Extending the prohibition of certain telephone order charges by third-party food delivery services.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the prohibition of certain telephone order charges by third-party food delivery services

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders

History.Description: This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill would amend an existing law that prohibits third-party food delivery services - entities that provide food service establishments with online order and delivery services - from charging such establishments for telephone orders that did not result in a transaction during the call. Under the existing law, such charges are prohibited only when certain conditions apply. This bill would instead prohibit such charges from the anticipated end date of those conditions until February 17, 2022.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision b of section 20-847 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 87 for the year 2020, is amended to read as follows:
          b. The requirements of this section apply only [during the period in which a state disaster emergency has been declared by the governor of the state of New York or a state of emergency has been declared by the mayor, such declaration is in effect in the city, and all food service establishments in the city are prohibited from operating at the maximum indoor occupancy and for a period of 90 days thereafter] until February 17, 2022.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately, except that if it becomes law after August 17, 2021, it shall be retroactive to and deemed to have been in effect on and after August 17, 2021.
